intro: Gerardia harperi, commonly known as the Florida gerardia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds. It has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Gerardia harperi plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is considered an important component of wetland ecosystems.
